body.p: This document outlines the strategy proposed by the TEI Editors for the next Revision of TEI P4, the new XML/SGML compatible version of the TEI Guidelines. Our guiding principle in drawing this up has been to avoid as far as possible any major revision of the content of the Guidelines — not because we believe such revision to be unnecessary but because we believe it should be carried out by properly constituted and chartered workgroups. We believe the topics listed here are all necessary and non-controversial modifications, motivated only by the desire to catch up on some of the technical and infrastructural changes in the world since 1994.

div.head: Current state of play
Work to be done
div.p: Much of the above work is fairly easy and uncontentious. Other parts are more problematic, requiring either larger investments of time and effort than are readily available or requiring wider consultation with the TEI community. In particular, it seems to us that the character encoding recommendations (primarily chap 4 but also 25, 37) have been largely overtaken by events, and are thus overdue for review. We propose that a workgroup be chartered by the Board to address this problem as soon as possible, in advance of the existence of the TEI Council which should formally ratify its work. A separate document (TEI EDW72) proposes a charge and suggests an initial membership for this workgroup. The group will be asked to produce a preliminary report in time for the first TEI members meeting in mid October, by when it is hoped that a significant proportion of the remainder of the workplan specified in the next section will also be completed.

div.head: Editorial work plan
div.p:
We list below a very minimal workplan, subject to review and reaction from the Board and from the panel of proof readers we hope to recruit.
Redraft Gentle Guide to include XML: LB to do by mid-Sept
Introduce discussion of Xlink and related standards into chapter 14 (linking and alignment): SDR to do by mid-Sept
Recruit volunteer proof readers, allocate chapters to them, act on their feedback: LB/SDR to complete by start October.
Revise bibliography: volunteer needed
Review chapter 39 (formal grammar): volunteer needed
Review chapter 28, 29, 30 (conformance, modification, interchange) for significant content changes: volunteer needed
Propose new material on Dublin Core, RDF and other relevant metadata standards for inclusion in chapters 5 and 24 (the Header): volunteer needed;
Propose material on MathML (and namespaces?) for chapter 22 (Tables, formulae, and graphics): volunteer needed
Revise chap 27 (Tagset doc) to include specification of the ODD system as used in P4 : LB to do, but not any time soon
Review discussion of CONCUR in chapter 31
